Name: Alfajores
Description: a Christmas pastry ( very different from Latin American alfajores )

Name: Catànies
Description: Catalan marcona almonds covered with white chocolate and powdered black chocolate to be eaten with the coffee

Name: Churros
Description: fried-dough pastry-based snacks , sometimes made from potato dough

Name: Flan Crème caramel , or caramel custard
Description: a rich custard dessert with a layer of soft caramel on top , as opposed to crème brûlée , which is custard with a hard caramel top

Name: Crème brûlée burnt cream , crema catalana , or Trinity cream
Description: a dessert consisting of a rich custard base topped with a layer of hard caramel , created by caramelizing sugar under a broiler , with a blowtorch or other intense heat source , or by pouring cooked caramel on top of the custard . It is usually served cold in individual ramekins

Name: Frangollo
Description: a dessert made from milk , millet or maize flour , lemon , eggs , sugar , butter , raisins , almonds , and cinnamon . Many variations exist : the milk may be replaced by water , aniseed may be added

Name: Marie biscuit
Description: a type of sweet biscuit similar to a Rich Tea biscuit . It is made with wheat flour , sugar , vegetable oil and vanilla flavoring

Name: Marzipan
Region: Toledo and Soto de Cameros ( La Rioja )
Description: a confection consisting primarily of sugar and almond meal

Name: Panellets
Description: traditional dessert of the All Saints holiday in the Catalan Countries , together with chestnuts , sweet potatoes or sweet wine . Panellets ( Catalan for little breads ) are small cakes or cookies in different shapes , mostly round , made mainly of marzipan

Name: Quince Paste membrillo
Description: a sweet , thick , quince jelly or quince candy

Name: Tarta de Santiago
Description: almond pie fillied with ground almonds , eggs and sugar . The top of the pie is usually decorated with powdered sugar , masked by an imprint of the Saint James cross

Name: Teja
Description: a popular dumpling-shaped confection that contains manjar blanco filling ( similar to dulce de leche ) and either dry fruits or nuts

Name: Tortas de Aceite
Description: a light , crispy and flaky Sevillian biscuit

Name: Tortell
Description: a Catalan typically O-shaped pastry stuffed with marzipan , that on some special occasions is topped with glazed fruit

Name: Turrón torró , or torrone
Description: a nougat confection , typically made of honey , sugar , and egg white , with toasted almonds or other nuts , and usually shaped into either a rectangular tablet or a round cake
